title: Print, "Les Plaisirs de le'Eté", ca. 1725
markings: Marked in black ink, lower left: 3 (and other marks, see object); graphite line outlining shape of fan
inscribed: Inscribed on plate, lower center: Les Plaisirs de l'Eté./Se Vend à Paris chez Dubis rue du petit/Pont proche le petit Châtelet/à la Tete Noire.; below: Avec privilege du Roy
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Escutcheon. The amusements of summer. A boy bringing a girl apples. The girl is seated in a park, and a slave boy holds an umbrella over her. A sleeping child is on top.

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, "Les Plaisirs de le'Eté", ca. 1725.
ca. 1725. Etching on off-white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1921-6-73-b.
